meanings.definition: To price (something) higher than the competition.
meanings.sent1: The store outpriced its rivals to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: The new phone model was outpriced by other brands in the market.
meanings.sent3: The bakery playfully outpriced the nearby cafes to sell more pastries.
meanings.sent4: Her talent outpriced all the other candidates in the audition.
meanings.sent5: The artist's unique style outpriced traditional paintings at the gallery.

meanings.sent1: The outpriced product struggled to compete with cheaper alternatives.
meanings.sent2: Customers avoided the outpriced luxury items in the store.
meanings.sent3: The outpriced tickets to the concert left many fans disappointed.
meanings.sent4: The outpriced hotel room made the traveler seek more affordable accommodation.
meanings.sent5: The outpriced car stood out among the budget-friendly options on the lot.
